author: bfonta
body:
This PR improves the clarity of the `MonitorElement` error message when the kind requested does not match the underlying instance's kind.
The old version threw an uninformative `assert()` message, while the new version explicitly prints the requested kind and the underlying kind.

As an example, if one requests a `TH2D` out of a `MonitorElement` containing a `TH2F`, via:

```c++
TH2D* h = src->getTH2D();
```

(where "src" is a `MonitorElement*`), the following error is thrown:

```bash                                             
----- Begin Fatal Exception 12-Feb-2026 16:40:21 CET-----------------------                                                                 
An exception of category 'MonitorElementError' occurred while                                                                               
   [0] Processing end ProcessBlock                                                                                                          
   [1] Calling method for module METTesterPostProcessor/'hltMETPostProcessor'                                                               
Exception Message:                                                                                                                          
Wrong kind of MonitorElement: TH2F instead of TH2D.                                                                                         
----- End Fatal Exception -------------------------------------------------  
```

The original errror message was:

```bash
cmsRun: src/DQMServices/Core/src/MonitorElement.cc:1122: virtual TH2D* dqm::impl::MonitorElement::getTH2D(): Assertion `kind() == Kind::TH2D
' failed.
```
title: DQM Monitor Element: improve Kind debug message
